title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there are no children nodes listed. The new data source does not show any database, table, or column information.
EB: The children nodes should be listed when changing the data source. The expected result is that when a new data source is selected, the corresponding children (database, table, column information) should be listed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 
2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page. 
3. Change the data source to a different one. 

Actual result: No children nodes are listed for the new data source. 

To workaround the issue, close the data set editor and reopen it.
